greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of n X k Young tableaux, where 0 <= k <= n.
link: Index entries for sequences related to Young tableaux.
formula: T(n, k) = (n*k)!*BarnesG(n+1)*BarnesG(k+1)/BarnesG(n+k+1), where BarnesG(n) = A000178. - _G. C. Greubel_, May 04 2021
mathematica: T[n_, k_]:= (n*k)!/Product[Product[i+j-1, {j,1,k}], {i,1,n}]; Table[T[n, k], {n, 0, 7}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Amiram Eldar_, Nov 17 2018 *)
Table[T[n, k], {n, 0, 5}, {k, 0, n}] //Flatten (* _G. C. Greubel_, May 04 2021 *)
program: A321716:= func< n,k | n eq 0 select 1 else Factorial(n*k)/(&*[ Round(Gamma(j+k)/Gamma(j)): j in [1..n]]) >;
def A321716(n,k): return factorial(n*k)/product( gamma(j+k)/gamma(j) for j in (1..n) )
flatten([[A321716(n,k) for k in (0..n)] for n in (0..12)]) # _G. C. Greubel_, May 04 2021
results.author: _Seiichi Manyama_, Nov 17 2018
